docs.lead_paragraph: In a new setback for the health care law and the people it's supposed to help, the government said Friday it made a tax-reporting error that's fouling up the filings of nearly a million Americans.

headline.main: New Woes for HealthCare.gov: Wrong Tax Info Sent Out
headline.print_headline: New Woes for HealthCare.gov: Wrong Tax Info Sent Out

docs.snippet: In a new setback for the health care law and the people it's supposed to help, the government said Friday it made a tax-reporting error that's fouling up the filings of nearly a million Americans.

docs.lead_paragraph: Tips to manage your taxes if you are one of the thousands who received incorrect tax forms from the federal government.

headline.main: What to Do if You Got the Wrong Tax Forms
headline.print_headline: What to Do if You Got the Wrong Tax Forms

docs.abstract: Tips for thousands of Obamacare buyers who received wrong tax forms from the federal government.
docs.snippet: Tips to manage your taxes if you are one of the thousands who received incorrect tax forms from the federal government.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Health insurance marketplaces have been reopened so that people won’t be shut out of coverage — and forced to pay a penalty — for a second year.

headline.main: A Second Chance to Avoid a Second Tax Penalty Over Obamacare

docs.snippet: Health insurance marketplaces have been reopened so that people won’t be shut out of coverage — and forced to pay a penalty — for a second year.

docs.lead_paragraph: The tax mix-up, affecting taxpayers in 37 states, is the first major problem to surface in an otherwise smooth second enrollment period for the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: Tax Error in Health Act Has Impact on 800,000
headline.print_headline: Tax Error in Health Act Has Impact on 800,000

docs.abstract: Nearly 800,000 Americans who enrolled in insurance policies through HealthCare.gov are sent wrong information on forms they need to complete their 2014 tax returns; mistake could cause hardship for lower-income Americans who are qualified for subsidized insurance.
docs.snippet: The tax mix-up, affecting taxpayers in 37 states, is the first major problem to surface in an otherwise smooth second enrollment period for the Affordable Care Act.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: A report by the American Association for Long-Term Care Insurance finds that rates rose this year an average of 9 percent.

headline.main: Long-Term Care Insurance: Costs Are Up but Vary Widely
headline.print_headline: Long-Term Care Insurance: Costs Are Up but Vary Widely

docs.abstract: Ann Carrns Your Money Adviser column offers questions and answers about long-term care insurance, in light of American Assn for Long-Term Care Insurance report that found rates rose in 2014 by nearly 9 percent.
docs.snippet: A report by the American Association for Long-Term Care Insurance finds that rates rose this year an average of 9 percent.

keywords.value: American Association for Long-Term Care Insurance
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: University of Scranton employee insurance plans will no longer cover abortions in cases of rape, incest or life-threatening pregnancies under a plan that the Jesuit school says is consistent with Catholic doctrine.

headline.main: Pennsylvania College Aims to End Insurance Coverage of Abortions in Rape Cases

docs.lead_paragraph: More hospitals and doctors are starting to use data from fitness trackers and health apps to help treat patients. But they are moving cautiously. The technology has a lot of potential, but there are key challenges to work out:

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Scott Walker backed a surprise move Friday by Republican legislators to quickly vote on making Wisconsin a right-to-work state, an action the likely 2016 presidential candidate initially said should be delayed to avoid re-igniting massive pro-union protests.

headline.main: Gov. Walker Backs Push to Make Wisconsin Right-To-Work State

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration said on Friday that 800,000 people who signed up for health insurance under the Affordable Care Act received incorrect tax forms and should wait to receive new ones before filing their taxes.

headline.main: Incorrect Tax Forms Sent to 800,000 U.S. Health Exchange Enrollees
headline.print_headline: Incorrect Tax Forms Sent to 800,000 U.S. Health Exchange Enrollees
